news.title: Manipal Group’s promoter family buys ₹64 crore apartment in Bengaluru
news.para: Shruti R Pai, wife of Manipal Group's Chairman, has acquired a luxury apartment in Bengaluru's Jayamahal Extension for Rs 64 crore. This transaction highlights a growing trend of high-value apartment purchases in Bengaluru, driven by demand from HNIs and industrialists. The city's luxury real estate market is experiencing a surge, fueled by limited inventory and an increasing number of UHNIs.

news.title: About 60 Sushant Lok houses get final warning for violations in Gurugram
news.para: Gurugram's DTCP has escalated enforcement in Sushant Lok 2, issuing restoration orders against over 60 properties. These properties are in violation of building norms and engaging in unauthorized commercial activities. This action follows unheeded notices regarding illegal constructions and commercial operations like coaching centers and salons.

news.title: Homebuyers are 'plotting' deals as land prices climb
news.para: Plotted developments are becoming popular with second-home buyers. These buyers are attracted by appreciation potential and flexibility. Land prices have risen significantly in major cities. Developers are creating plotted communities with amenities.

news.title: Building sites in Ahmedabad under scanner for ‘masking’ air pollution data
news.para: Ahmedabad developers are allegedly manipulating air quality sensors at construction sites. They are covering sensors with wet cloths to show lower pollution levels. The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) implemented rules in 2023 to curb air pollution. These rules mandate air quality sensors at large construction sites. AMC is now working to prevent sensor tampering.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government plans to reintroduce BPS & LRS to tackle illegal constructions
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh government is considering reintroducing the Building Penalisation Scheme (BPS) and Layout Regularisation Scheme (LRS) to address the proliferation of illegal structures and layouts. This initiative aims to streamline unauthorized constructions, boost state revenue, and ensure public safety.

news.title: Punjab cabinet approves amendments to land pooling policy
news.para: The Punjab Cabinet has approved changes to its land pooling policy. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has defended the scheme against opposition criticism. He says farmers will receive compensation and can continue farming until development begins. Landowners will get residential and commercial plots in exchange for their land.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh cabinet approves 1% discount in stamp duty on property purchased in name of women
news.para: The Uttar Pradesh Cabinet has approved a one per cent stamp duty discount for women buying property up to Rs one crore, aiming to empower them financially and boost the Mission Shakti program. Additionally, the cabinet approved allocating land for an IRDE-DRDO center in the Uttar Pradesh Defense Industrial Corridor, which will generate employment and advance indigenous IR detector technology.

news.title: Dalmia Bharat's net profit up three-fold to ₹395 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Dalmia Bharat Ltd witnessed a substantial surge in net profit, reaching Rs 395 crore in the June quarter, driven by enhanced sales and reduced expenses. While revenue remained relatively stable at Rs 3,636 crore, sales volume experienced a 5.8% increase. The company's robust EBITDA growth and strategic vision are propelling its expansion towards becoming a PAN-India player.

news.title: Adani group seeks Competition Commission's nod to acquire Jaiprakash Associates
news.para: The Adani Group has sought CCI approval to acquire Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL), which is undergoing corporate insolvency resolution. Adani's bid follows a similar move by Dalmia Cement, as multiple companies vie to acquire the debt-ridden infrastructure conglomerate. JAL, admitted into CIRP due to loan defaults, possesses significant real estate and cement assets.

news.title: Adani group firm to develop Paytm's IT complex in Noida
news.para: Paytm has appointed Manorview Developers, an Adani Group subsidiary, as the EPC contractor for its IT and ITes complex in Noida's Sector 159. This decision follows the termination of a previous joint development agreement with ACE Builders and Promoters due to non-compliance with NOIDA regulations. Paytm will now independently develop the 10-acre project.

news.title: Hearing a lot about Gurugram court in cheque bounce cases: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court expressed concern over coercive actions by a Gurugram trial court against homebuyers in cheque bounce cases. The court will investigate the matter, citing awareness of the court's operations. This development arose during a hearing on petitions from over 1,200 homebuyers alleging forced EMI payments despite lacking possession of flats.

news.title: Punjab ups land pooling stakes, farmers to get ₹1 lakh per acre yearly
news.para: Facing opposition, the Punjab government has increased incentives for farmers in its land pooling policy, offering an initial Rs 50,000 per acre annually before possession and Rs 1 lakh after. The scheme aims to provide farmers with residential and commercial plots in planned colonies, ensuring long-term income.

news.title: Motilal Oswal Alternates raises ₹2,000 crore through its sixth real estate fund
news.para: Motilal Oswal Alternates has secured ₹2,000 crore for its sixth real estate fund, IREF-VI, from family offices, HNIs, and offshore investors. The fund has already committed 75% of its capital across 15 projects, primarily in mid-income residential developments, and achieved a first exit with a 20.25% IRR. MO Alternates' real estate AUM now exceeds ₹10,000 crore.

news.title: China's outstanding property loans up 0.4% in Q2 2025
news.para: China's property loans reached a two-year high in June, climbing 0.4% year-on-year to 53.33 trillion yuan, fueled by policy support measures. While mortgage loans dipped slightly, property development loans saw a modest increase. Despite these efforts, the property downturn continues to weigh on the economy, with falling investment and new home prices.

news.title: Akzo Nobel eyes decorative paint disposals in Asia after $1.6 billion India unit sale
news.para: Akzo Nobel, following the sale of its India unit, is shifting its focus to business-to-business offerings in Asia. The company plans to increase investments in performance coatings while divesting some decorative paints units in the region. CEO Greg Poux-Guillaume stated that future disposals are unlikely to include royalty agreements.

news.title: Odisha: Govt departments asked to submit action taken reports on RERA Act implementation
news.para: To bolster the Odisha Real Estate Regulatory Authority's effectiveness, the housing and urban development department has assigned specific tasks to various agencies and government departments, setting deadlines for completion. These departments are required to submit action taken reports promptly.

news.title: HCBS Developments to invest ₹700 crore to develop residential project in Gurugram
news.para: HCBS Developments will invest ₹700 crore in Gurugram. The investment aims to develop Twin Horizon, a residential project in Sector 102. This project spans 5.2902 acres. It is expected to generate ₹1,400 crore in revenue. Twin Horizon will feature two high-rise towers. It will offer 268 residential units and seven commercial units. Morphogenesis designed the project.

news.title: SC allows Adani Cementation to cut 158 mangrove trees for captive jetty project along Amba river
news.para: The Supreme Court has upheld the Bombay High Court's decision, permitting Adani Cementation to cut 158 mangrove trees for a jetty project in Raigad district. This project aims to facilitate cement transport via waterways, addressing the increasing cement demand in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. The court prioritized sustainable development, balancing the project's necessity with ecological protection.

news.title: IHCL, Ambuja Neotia Group ink pact for 15 new hotels, focus on east, northeast region
news.para: Indian Hotels Company (IHCL) and Ambuja Neotia Group have partnered to develop 15 new hotels, primarily in east and northeast India. Ambuja Neotia Group will invest between Rs 1,500 crore to Rs 2,000 crore in greenfield, brownfield, and conversion projects across West Bengal, Sikkim, and Himachal Pradesh.
